Professor of Interdisciplinary Social Science at Utrecht University

profile_positions.description:
Assistant Professor in the Department of Interdisciplinary Social Science (Youth Studies) at Utrecht University. My research focuses on adolescent health and well-being, in particular mental health, substance use and sexuality. I examine national and international trends over time and study cross-national and gender inequalities. 

I teach the 'Introduction to Psychology' course and coordinate and teach the 'Developmental Psychology' course at University College Utrecht. At the Department of Interdisciplinary Social Science, I coordinate the course 'Youth and Sexuality', teach in the course 'Risk Behaviour and Addiction', and supervise students writing their mastertheses.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
Postdoctoral researcher on the Health Behaviour in School-aged Children (HBSC) study, focusing on explaining cross-national differences in adolescent health and well-being. 

Lecturer at University College Utrecht (course: Introduction to Psychology) and at Utrecht University (course: Philosophy of Science).
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher and Lecturer

profile_positions.description: Researcher in a project on contextual (neighborhood) influences on adolescent substance use in Canada, in collaboration with prof. William Pickett, prof. Ian Janssen, prof. Wendy Craig, and prof. Frank Elgar.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Scholar (Postdoc)

profile_positions.description: Researcher in the Health Behaviour in School-aged Children (HBSC) study in the Netherlands in 2009/10; analysing data; writing scientific and policy-oriented articles for international peer-reviewed journals
profile_positions.title: PhD researcher

company.name: UC Berkeley, School of Public Health & Public Health Institute, Oakland
